verses.verse: Oh that <S%H5414><s%> you were like my brother, <S%H251><s%> who nursed <S%H3243><s%> from the breasts <S%H7699><s%> of my mother! <S%H517><s%> If I found <S%H4672><s%> you outside, <S%H2351><s%> I would kiss <S%H5401><s%> you; <S%H936><s%> yes, and no one would despise me.

I would lead <S%H5090><s%> you, <S%H935><s%> bringing you into my mother <S%H517><s%>'s house, <S%H1004><s%> who would instruct <S%H3925><s%> me. <S%H8248><s%> I would have you drink spiced <S%H7544><s%> wine, <S%H3196><s%> of the juice <S%H6071><s%> of my pomegranate. <S%H7416><s%>
His left hand <S%H8040><s%> would be under my head. <S%H7218><s%> His right hand <S%H3225><s%> would embrace me. <S%H2263><s%>

I adjure <S%H7650><s%> you, <S%H1323><s%> daughters of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> that you not stir up, <S%H5782><s%> nor awaken <S%H5782><s%> love, <S%H160><s%> until it so desires. <S%H2654><s%> Friends

Who is this who comes up <S%H5927><s%> from the wilderness, <S%H4057><s%> leaning <S%H7514><s%> on her beloved? <S%H1730><s%> Under the apple tree <S%H8598><s%> I aroused <S%H5782><s%> you. <S%H517><s%> There your mother conceived <S%H2254><s%> you. <S%H3205><s%> There she was in labor and bore you. <S%H2254><s%>

Set <S%H7760><s%> me as a seal <S%H2368><s%> on your heart, <S%H3820><s%> as a seal <S%H2368><s%> on your arm; <S%H2220><s%> for love <S%H160><s%> is strong <S%H5794><s%> as death. <S%H4194><s%> Jealousy <S%H7068><s%> is as cruel <S%H7186><s%> as Sheol. <S%H7585><s%> Its flashes <S%H7565><s%> are flashes <S%H7565><s%> of fire, <S%H784><s%> a very flame of Yahweh. <S%H7957><s%>

Many <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> can't <S%H3201><s%> quench <S%H3518><s%> love, <S%H160><s%> neither can floods <S%H5104><s%> drown <S%H7857><s%> it. <S%H376><s%> If a man would give <S%H5414><s%> all the wealth <S%H1952><s%> of his house <S%H1004><s%> for love, <S%H160><s%> he would be utterly <S%H936><s%> scorned. <S%H936><s%> Friends

We have a little <S%H6996><s%> sister. <S%H269><s%> She has no breasts. <S%H7699><s%> What shall we do <S%H6213><s%> for our sister <S%H269><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> when she is to be spoken for? <S%H1696><s%>

If she is a wall, <S%H2346><s%> we will build <S%H1129><s%> on her a turret <S%H2918><s%> of silver. <S%H3701><s%> if she is a door, <S%H1817><s%> we will enclose <S%H6696><s%> her with boards <S%H3871><s%> of cedar. <S%H730><s%> Beloved
I am a wall, <S%H2346><s%> and my breasts <S%H7699><s%> like towers, <S%H4026><s%> then I was in his eyes <S%H5869><s%> like one who found <S%H4672><s%> peace. <S%H7965><s%>

Solomon <S%H8010><s%> had a vineyard <S%H3754><s%> at Baal Hamon. <S%H1174><s%> He leased out <S%H5414><s%> the vineyard <S%H3754><s%> to keepers. <S%H5201><s%> Each <S%H376><s%> was to bring <S%H935><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> shekels of silver <S%H3701><s%> for its fruit. <S%H6529><s%>

My own vineyard <S%H3754><s%> is before <S%H6440><s%> me. <S%H505><s%> The thousand are for you, <S%H8010><s%> Solomon; two hundred <S%H3967><s%> for those who tend <S%H5201><s%> its fruit. <S%H6529><s%> Lover
You who dwell <S%H3427><s%> in the gardens, <S%H1588><s%> with friends <S%H2270><s%> in attendance, <S%H7181><s%> let me hear <S%H7181><s%> your voice! <S%H6963><s%> Beloved
Come away, <S%H1272><s%> my beloved! <S%H1730><s%> Be like <S%H1819><s%> a gazelle <S%H6643><s%> or a young <S%H6082><s%> stag <S%H354><s%> on the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of spices! <S%H1314><s%>
